tit.e: Sanbuitiginno (Payment of One Third of Land Tax in Silver)
Sanbuitiginno (Payment of One Third of Land Tax in Silver)
Sanbuichiginno (Payment of One Third of Land Tax in Silver)

sen.j: 三分一銀納（さんぶいちぎんのう）は、江戸時代、田畑年貢の三分の一を銀納としたこと。
sen.e: Sanbuitiginno was the payment of one third of the agricultural land tax in silver during the Edo period.
Sanbuitiginno was the payment of one third of the agricultural land tax in silver during the Edo period.
Sanbuichiginno was the payment of one third of the agricultural land tax in silver during the Edo period.

sen.j: 主として関西で行われたため、銀納を普通としたが、金納の地もあった。
sen.e: Payment in silver was the standard as the practice was mainly conducted in the Kansai region, but there were also areas in which payment was in gold.
Payment in silver was the standard as the practice was mainly conducted in the Kansai region, but there were also areas in which payment was in gold.
Payment in silver was the standard as the practice was mainly conducted in the Kansai region, but there were also areas in which payment was in gold.

sen.j: また大和国のようにその全てが石代納の国もあり、また3分の2の米納の分もその幾分かを石代納とする地もあった。
sen.e: There were also provinces such as Yamato Province in which all payment was in cash as well as areas in which two thirds of tax to be paid in rice were paid in cash.
There were also provinces such as Yamato Province in which all payment was in cash as well as areas in which two thirds of tax to be paid in rice were paid in cash.
There were also provinces such as Yamato Province in which all payment was in cash as well as areas in which two thirds of tax to be paid in rice were paid in cash in some degree.

sen.j: この場合は、三分一銀納の石代よりも高率であった。
sen.e: Such tax systems were more common than sanbuitiginno.

In such cases, the tax rate was higher than sanbuichiginno.
sen.cmt: 誤訳のため変更しました。Sanbuitiginno→Sanbuichiginno

sen.j: すなわち享保10年の令によれば、その石代は三分一金銀納の石代に、さらに35石につき金3両、銀納の地方は米1石に銀5匁を増加して納めさせた。
sen.e: An edict of 1725 proclaimed that one third of cash tax payments was to be made in gold in addition to an increase of 3 ryo per 35 koku and an increase of 3 monme per 1 koku of rice in areas in which payment was in silver.

An edict of 1725 proclaimed that one third of cash tax payments was to be made in gold in addition to an increase of 3 ryo per 35 koku and an increase of 3 monme per 1 koku of rice in areas in which payment was in silver.

An edict of 1725 proclaimed that the amount of payment was that of one third of cash tax payments in gold or silver in addition to an increase of 3 ryo gold per 35 koku and an increase of 5 monme silver per 1 koku of rice.
sen.cmt: 誤訳があるので全体を書き換えました。 amout→amount

sen.j: 三分一銀納は、明治3年7月まで継続した。
sen.e: Sanbuitiginno continued until June 1870.
Sanbuitiginno continued until June 1870.
Sanbuichiginno continued until July 1870.
